text: Prejudices are so to speak the mechanical instincts of men: through their prejudices they do without any effort many things they would find too difficult to think through to the point of resolving to do them.
author: Georg C. Lichtenberg

text: No man has any natural authority over his fellow men.
author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

text: In a free society the state does not administer the affairs of men. It administers justice among men who conduct their own affairs.
author: Walter Lippmann

text: The most positive men are the most credulous.
author: Alexander Pope

text: My mother was the most beautiful woman I ever saw. All I am I owe to my mother. I attribute all my success in life to the moral, intellectual and physical education I received from her.
author: George Washington
